data.zh: 注意你何时戛然而止。当这种状态变得太不舒服，你就会重新回到正常的生活。当所有负面想法涌上心头，而你又无法应对时，就是这种感觉。如果你学会享受坚持不懈的过程，所有奇迹就会发生。

data.en: If you aren't where you want to be, the most important thing in your life is one hour of needle-moving effort (when your energy is highest) on a project that wasn't assigned to you by parents, teachers, or employers.
data.zh: 如果你还没有达到你想要的目标，那么你生命中最重要的事情就是在你精力最充沛的时候，花一个小时全力以赴地完成一个并非父母、老师或雇主分配给你的项目。

data.en: Schedule interruptions in your day to help you remember that your daily mindless string of tasks aren't life. Think about your death. Go on a walk and stare at the sky. Close your eyes and listen to a beautiful song. Snap yourself out of mechanical living.
data.zh: 在日常生活中安排一些干扰，帮助你记住，你每天机械重复的任务并非生活的全部。想想死亡。出去散散步，看看天空。闭上眼睛，听一首动听的歌。让自己从机械的生活中抽离出来。

data.en: The solution to most of your problems is perspective.
data.zh: 大多数问题的解决之道在于换个角度看问题。

data.en: I know that everyone wants to build a note-taking/writing/productivity app. I know that we're stupid for doing it. I know we're going to waste a lot of time and money. I know that we could make 100x more, faster, doing something else. Don't care. Still doing it. Team is hungry.
data.zh: 我知道每个人都想开发一款笔记/写作/效率类应用。我知道我们这样做很愚蠢。我知道我们会浪费大量的时间和金钱。我知道如果我们做其他事情，可以更快地赚到百倍的利润。不在乎。照样做。团队渴望胜利。

data.en: The best way to learn is to commit to a real world project that forces you to learn what can't be taught in schools: skills that get non-linear results, how to navigate failure, and how to think outside the box.
data.zh: 学习的最佳方法是投身于现实世界的项目，迫使你学习学校里学不到的东西：获得非线性结果的技能、如何应对失败以及如何跳出思维定式。

data.en: You aren't lost. You're too used to what you know. New becomes normal very quick. When you feel lost, the solution is to become more lost. Throw yourself out of your current way of life and I promise you'll find something to grab onto.
data.zh: 你并没有迷路，只是太习惯于熟悉的事物了。新的事物很快就会变成常态。当你感到迷茫时，解决办法就是让自己更加迷茫。跳出你现有的生活方式，我保证你会找到可以依靠的东西。

data.en: They won't believe in you. The business. The crazy idea. The aspirations so large that most people's minds don't have any other option but to call you delusional. And you are, but only if you don't make it happen.
data.zh: 他们不会相信你。这家公司。这个疯狂的想法。这些雄心壮志如此之大，以至于大多数人除了认为你异想天开之外，别无选择。没错，但前提是你不让它发生。

data.en: The single thing that keeps most people stuck is that they do what they want but never self-reflect and realize they don't actually want that.
data.zh: 大多数人之所以停滞不前，是因为他们做了自己想做的事，却从不进行自我反思，也从未意识到自己实际上并不想要那样的生活。

data.en: Don't look for goals. Look for interesting problems and the right goal will emerge.
data.zh: 不要刻意寻找目标，而要寻找有趣的问题，合适的目标自然会浮现。

data.en: Your goals determine what opportunities you can see, but most people run on a set of unconscious goals installed by their parents and peers, so they never notice the ideas in everyday situations, conversations, books, and content that could change their life.
data.zh: 你的目标决定了你能看到哪些机会，但大多数人都是按照父母和同龄人灌输的一套无意识目标行事，所以他们从未注意到日常生活、对话、书籍和内容中那些可能改变他们生活的想法。

data.en: If you want to see a quick jump in quality of life start going on a 15 minute walk first thing in the morning, right after you wake up, no matter what the weather is.
data.zh: 如果你想快速提高生活质量，那就每天早上醒来后第一件事就是进行 15 分钟的散步，无论天气如何。

data.en: When your vision is clear nothing else matters. You drop everything. Books aren't interesting. Routines hold you back. If your mind wants to focus on reaching the next peak, don't slow it down. Let it consume you.
data.zh: 当你的目光清晰时，其他一切都不重要了。你会放下一切。书籍不再有趣。循规蹈矩只会阻碍你前进。如果你的思绪渴望攀登下一个高峰，那就不要让它停下。让它全神贯注于你。

data.en: If you want to attract people to you, focus on your mission. People gravitate toward those who know what they want.
data.zh: 如果你想吸引人们，就专注于你的使命。人们会被那些知道自己想要什么的人所吸引。

data.en: The plan for 2025 is to write, walk, read, build, train, and adapt as usual.
data.zh: 2025 年的计划是照常写作、行走、阅读、建设、训练和适应。

data.en: The difference between where you are and where you want to be is knowledge because if you knew how to get there (and actually wanted to) you wouldn't be able to think or do anything else.
data.zh: 你现在所处的位置和你想要到达的位置之间的区别在于知识，因为如果你知道如何到达那里（并且真的想去那里），你就不会去思考或做其他任何事情了。

data.en: Start wide, try everything. Notice signal, ignore noise. Go deep, master it. Create something, anything. Share it with others. Enjoy and repeat.
data.zh: 从最宽的范围开始，尝试所有方法。只关注信号，忽略噪声。深入钻研，精通它。创作一些东西，任何东西都可以。分享给其他人。尽情享用，反复体验。

data.en: Nothing beats having a buildup of meaningful ideas to write about, throwing on headphones, blaring music so you're forced to drown it out, and emptying your mind just to do it all over again. Nothing beats being a vessel for creativity.
data.zh: 没有什么比积累了一堆值得写作的精彩想法，然后戴上耳机，播放震耳欲聋的音乐，强迫自己屏蔽掉这些想法，最后清空思绪，再重复一遍更棒的了。没有什么比成为创造力的容器更棒的了。

data.en: You don't need more knowledge because you already know what you need to do. You're studying level 5 at level 1 and it's only adding more things to forget about when you decide to start..
data.zh: 你不需要更多知识，因为你已经知道自己该做什么了。你现在在1级就学5级的内容，这只会让你在真正开始学习的时候忘记更多东西。

data.en: You don't find passion. You become passionate according to the amount of energy you invest in an interest.
data.zh: 你找不到激情。你对某项兴趣投入的精力越多，你就会越充满热情。

data.en: Your audience doesn't want information. They want YOUR perspective on information. 10 people can share the same idea. Only one will say it in a way that changes minds.
data.zh: 你的听众并不想获取信息。他们想听听你对信息的看法。十个人可能持有相同的想法，但只有一个人能用一种能改变别人想法的方式表达出来。

data.en: You didn't start this to become another "personal brand." You started because you wanted freedom. Meaningful income. The ability to create work that sets your soul on fire. Take your mind, without the labels, and stream it where anyone can watch.
data.zh: 你开始做这件事并不是为了打造另一个“个人品牌”。你创业的初衷是渴望自由、获得有意义的收入，以及创造能让你充满激情的工作。抛开一切标签，将你的思想自由表达，让所有人都能观看。

data.en: Most "content creators" are just search engines with profile pictures. Publish work that makes people question their existence.
data.zh: 大多数“内容创作者”只不过是换了头像的搜索引擎，发布一些让人质疑自身存在意义的作品。

data.en: If you never contradict yourself, you're probably too attached to a limiting belief, and it's holding you back from reaching the next level.
data.zh: 如果你从不自相矛盾，那你可能太执着于某种限制性信念，而这种信念会阻碍你达到更高的层次。

data.en: Learning from a mistake the first time is how you blow past everyone else who spend years in stagnation because their ego is too big to accept their faults.
data.zh: 第一次就从错误中吸取教训，你就能超越那些因为自负而多年停滞不前的人，因为他们无法接受自己的错误。

data.en: Your feelings don't have to dictate your behavior. You can do the right thing, and you can do it well, even if you don't feel like doing it. This is the ultimate skill you can practice that spills over into the entirety of your life.
data.zh: 你的感受不必决定你的行为。即使你不想做，你仍然可以做正确的事，而且可以做得很好。这是你可以练习的终极技能，它将对你生活的方方面面产生深远的影响。

data.en: The ultimate goal is to have a life so beautifully designed that work, rest, and play cease to exist. They all blur together and are indistinguishable.
data.zh: 最终目标是拥有一个设计得如此完美的生活，以至于工作、休息和娱乐不再存在。它们融为一体，难以区分。

data.en: Your life's work is to reach your potential. Plain and simple. Anything that leads to decay is a distraction that must be wrestled with and eliminated.
data.zh: 你毕生的使命就是发挥你的潜能。就这么简单。任何导致衰败的事物都是必须与之抗争并消除的干扰因素。

data.en: The only people who will ultimately be replaced by AI are those who are incapable (or unwilling) to learn how to run a business.
data.zh: 最终会被人工智能取代的，只有那些没有能力（或不愿意）学习如何经营企业的人。

data.en: You can't live a new life with your old actions. Once you finally realize that, you'll stop gripping on so tightly to the pleasures that don't serve you. If you really want to change, you will. Most people just fantasize about a better life as another source of pleasure.
data.zh: 你不可能用过去的行为开启新生活。一旦你真正意识到这一点，你就会停止紧紧抓住那些对你无益的享乐不放。如果你真的想改变，你就能做到。大多数人只是把对美好生活的幻想当作另一种享乐来源。

data.en: If you don't know where to start, start with yourself. Your fitness. Your nutrition. Your money. Your skill set. Your mindset. Solve one little pain point in your life and I promise you'll know what to do next.
data.zh: 如果你不知道从哪里开始，那就从自己开始。你的健康状况。你的营养状况。你的钱。你的技能。你的心态。解决生活中一个小小的痛点，我保证你就会知道接下来该做什么了。

data.en: Balance is found in the extremes. Pushing to failure. Prioritizing recovery. Deep focused work. Worry-free rest. Periods of intensity for rapid and rare progress followed by periods of consistency to maintain new baselines. Stuck in the middle is a slow and average death.
data.zh: 平衡存在于极端之中。挑战极限。重视恢复。深度专注的工作。无忧休息。高强度训练期以取得快速而难得的进步，随后是稳定训练期以维持新的基准线。夹在中间是一种缓慢而平庸的死亡。

data.en: You aren't disciplined because you keep putting yourself in environments that give you a chance to be undisciplined.
data.zh: 你缺乏自律，是因为你总是把自己置于容易放纵自己的环境中。

data.en: The only thing more difficult than pursuing the best version of yourself is not pursuing the best version of yourself.
data.zh: 唯一比追求成为最好的自己更难的，就是不去追求成为最好的自己。

data.en: You need to move. Your body. Your mind. Your projects. Your relationships. Your finances. Because if you don't, you don't stay the same, you slowly decay without realizing it until you reach the point where it's much, much harder to dig back out. Entropy waits for no one.
data.zh: 你需要搬家。你的身体。你的思想。你的事业。你的人际关系。你的财务状况。因为如果你不这样做，你就不会保持现状，你会慢慢衰败而不自知，直到你意识到这一点时，再也很难从中恢复过来。熵不会等人。

data.en: I hate to break it to you, but most of your beliefs are wrong. If you don't look back on your mind 10 years from now and laugh, you are just like that closed minded person you secretly despise. Beliefs are tools. Grip onto them and act, but let go when they don't serve you.
data.zh: 我很遗憾地告诉你，你的大部分信念都是错的。如果你十年后回首往事时没有一笑置之，那你就会变成你暗地里鄙视的那种思想封闭的人。信念只是工具。你可以紧紧抓住它们并付诸行动，但当它们不再对你有益时，就应该放手。

data.en: Pain is a great teacher because it helps you realize two things: what's worth suffering for and what you never want to experience again. Pain gives you direction. That's why most people are lost.
data.zh: 痛苦是一位伟大的导师，因为它能让你明白两件事：什么值得你为之受苦，以及什么是你永远不想再经历的。痛苦会指引你方向。这就是为什么大多数人会迷失方向。

data.en: The best writing isn't about stringing words together in a way that sounds smart. It's about hunting for great ideas, letting them marinate in your subconscious, and synthesizing them into something worth reading.
data.zh: 最好的写作并非是把文字堆砌得听起来高深莫测，而是去寻找绝妙的想法，让它们在潜意识里酝酿发酵，最终将它们提炼成值得一读的作品。

data.en: Working on a project and need help. Has to do with going on a walk. How has walking helped with your ideas, creativity, health, relationships, general quality of life, or anything else? What's your "walking" story?
data.zh: 我正在做一个项目，需要一些帮助。和散步有关。步行对你的想法、创造力、健康、人际关系、整体生活质量或其他方面有何帮助？你的“行走”故事是什么？

data.en: Your life changes when you finally realize that anything is possible (on a long enough time scale) as long as you build the steps that lead to it being possible.
data.zh: 当你最终意识到只要你采取必要的步骤，任何事情都有可能发生（从足够长的时间尺度来看），你的生活就会发生改变。

data.en: Those who struggle with money struggle with awareness. You pay people daily. You do work that pays you some and others more. Your life is filled with items you paid for. You're a part of the process but not aware of the process, so you're dependent on it and can't replicate it.
data.zh: 那些在金钱方面遇到困难的人，往往缺乏理财意识。你每天都要付钱给别人。你做的工作有的报酬低，有的报酬高。你的生活中充满了你花钱买来的东西。你是这个过程的一部分，但你并不了解这个过程，所以你依赖于它，却无法复制它。

data.en: You're overwhelmed because you're holding 1 year's worth of skill acquisition, work, and growth in your head rather than the 1 thing you can do right now to get there.
data.zh: 你感到不知所措，是因为你脑子里想的是一年的技能习得、工作和成长，而不是你现在可以做的那件能达到目标的事情。

data.en: You're unhappy because your mind becomes what you pay attention to, and you pay attention to what you think is important, and people have told you what you should think is important your entire life, but you haven't realized that maybe they don't know what they're talking about.
data.zh: 你之所以不快乐，是因为你的思想变成了你关注的东西，而你关注的是你认为重要的东西，人们在你一生中都在告诉你什么才是重要的，但你却没有意识到，也许他们根本不知道自己在说什么。

data.en: Having a plan B is for people who don't trust their ability to learn, build, and adapt.
data.zh: 制定备选方案的人，往往是不相信自己学习、建设和适应能力的人。

data.en: The average person feels cheated by the dream they were sold. School didn't prepare them for this. The job didn't give them enough money, time, or security. Since that's all they were taught, they don't see another way to live, so they drown in anything that will numb the pain.
data.zh: 普通人感觉自己被灌输的梦想欺骗了。学校教育没有让他们做好面对现实的准备。工作也无法给他们带来足够的金钱、时间和保障。由于他们从小接受的教育仅限于此，他们看不到其他的生活方式，于是沉溺于任何能麻痹痛苦的事物中。

data.en: If you can't solve a problem with hard work, you can probably solve it by going on a walk.
data.zh: 如果努力工作解决不了问题，或许出去散散步就能解决。

data.en: Do whatever you want. When you do, you will make massive mistakes. At that point, you no longer want it, and slowly course correct toward what you really want. If you always do what others want for you, you will never discover what you want.
data.zh: 随心所欲吧。但那样做，你会犯下大错。到那时，你就会不再想要那样的生活，并慢慢调整方向，朝着你真正想要的方向前进。如果你总是按照别人的意愿行事，你永远也发现自己真正想要的是什么。

data.en: If you struggle with mental clarity: - Pull out a piece of paper - Write down all of your thoughts - Cross out all of the distractions - Focus on what’s left A clear head can be as simple as putting your mind on paper and organizing it.
data.zh: 如果你难以保持思维清晰：掏出一张纸把你所有的想法都写下来。排除所有干扰因素专注于剩下的事情保持头脑清醒其实很简单，只需把你的想法写在纸上并整理好即可。

data.en: You actually can do whatever you want whenever you want, and if you have a decent set of values, you should.
data.zh: 实际上，你可以随时随地做任何你想做的事，如果你有一套良好的价值观，你就应该这样做。

data.en: You are learning every millisecond of the day. Your mind is a sponge soaking in information. Being programmed. Being conditioned. Being told what to do and how to do it. For most people, this is unconscious. If you were to learn, consciously, your life would turn around fast.
data.zh: 你每时每刻都在学习。你的大脑就像一块海绵，不断吸收信息，被灌输各种观念，被驯化，被告知该做什么以及该怎么做。对大多数人来说，这一切都是无意识的。如果你能有意识地学习，你的生活会很快发生改变。

data.en: Dopamine tells you when something is important to your survival-wired brain. Companies exploit this by testing combinations of fat, sugar, salt, fear, pleasure, and conviction to addict you. Very few things are important, and it's your duty to discover and pursue them.
data.zh: 多巴胺会告诉你，当某件事对你那颗以生存为本的大脑来说很重要时，它就会发出信号。公司利用这一点，通过测试脂肪、糖、盐、恐惧、快乐和信念的组合来让你上瘾。真正重要的事寥寥无几，而发现并追求它们是你的责任。

data.en: Most new wealth is being generated in the digital space because its barrier of entry is skill, not money or location.
data.zh: 大部分新增财富都是在数字领域创造的，因为数字领域的准入门槛是技能，而不是金钱或地域。

data.en: You aren't fulfilled because your mind makes sense of the world in stories and you stopped living your own.
data.zh: 你之所以感到不满足，是因为你的思维习惯用故事来理解世界，而你却停止了过自己的生活。

data.en: Go on more walks. Walk for no reason. Walk to solve a problem. Walk to blow off steam. Walk to get outside. Walk to listen, read, and learn. Walk to escape distractions. Walk to improve your health. Walk to think. A simple walking habit can change absolutely everything.
data.zh: 多散步。无缘无故地散步。散步解决问题。散步释放压力。散步亲近自然。散步聆听、阅读和学习。散步摆脱干扰。散步改善健康。散步思考。一个简单的散步习惯可以彻底改变一切。

data.en: The death of your business happens when you obsess over a website, logo, LLC, and taxes before you actually start getting customers.
data.zh: 当你在真正开始获得客户之前，就过分关注网站、标志、有限责任公司和税务问题时，你的企业就会走向衰亡。

data.en: If you're okay with 10 cents in your bank account, you won't see that as a problem. If you're okay with 20 pounds of extra body fat, you won't do anything to change it. Your standards – your settling point – will ruin you if they are absymally low.
data.zh: 如果你觉得银行账户里只有10美分没什么问题，你就不会觉得这是个问题。如果你能接受身上多余的20磅脂肪，你就不会采取任何措施去改变它。如果你的标准——你的底线——低得离谱，那将会毁了你。

data.en: Many successful people are born out of an overwhelming amount of negativity that they chose to use as fuel, not an excuse.
data.zh: 许多成功人士都是在经历了大量的负面情绪后才成长起来的，他们选择将负面情绪转化为动力，而不是借口。

data.en: Normalize disappearing for 1 hour a day to build a better future for yourself.
data.zh: 每天抽出1小时时间，为自己创造更美好的未来，这已经成为一种常态。

data.en: How to start a billion dollar business: Don't. Start a one-person business. Build enough cash flow to leave your job. Build enough of an audience to fuel that dream company you want to start. Focus on the skills and interests you can already help people with.
data.zh: 如何打造一家价值十亿美元的企业：不。创办一家一人企业。积累足够的现金流，以便辞职。建立足够多的受众群体，为你想要创办的梦想公司提供动力。专注于你已经拥有的技能和兴趣，并利用这些技能和兴趣帮助他人。

data.en: Most people end up 50 years old with the emotional maturity of a 15 year old.
data.zh: 大多数人到了50岁，情感成熟度却只有15岁左右。

data.en: If you're in your 20s: - Experiment with new paths - Start your business failures now - Study the opposite of your beliefs - Challenge yourself with new interests The worst thing you can do is stop learning, growing, and changing your mind after leaving the school system.
data.zh: 如果你正值二十多岁：- 尝试新的路径现在就开始你的创业失败吧研究与你信念相反的事物尝试培养新的兴趣爱好离开学校教育体系后，最糟糕的事情就是停止学习、成长和改变想法。

data.en: It's okay to disappear and build the thing you've been putting off (that will make you a better person when you come back).
data.zh: 消失一段时间，去做你一直拖延的事情（当你回来时，这将使你成为一个更好的人），这没什么不好。

data.en: I've talked about Tactical Stress in-depth multiple times in The Koe Letter. Don't miss another issue by joining below. I'll also send you a Simple Life Reset template for free.
data.zh: 我在《科伊通讯》中多次深入探讨了战术压力。立即加入，不错过任何一期精彩内容。我还会免费赠送你一份“极简生活重置”模板。

data.en: If you enjoyed this thread, share the first post so others can get through their negative emotions.
data.zh: 如果你喜欢这个帖子，请分享第一条帖子，让其他人也能摆脱负面情绪。

data.en: Reason #2 Parkinson's Law: Work expands so as to fill the time allotted for completion. When you launch yourself into the unknown, you threaten your survival, and you have less time to become a success.
data.zh: 原因二帕金森定律：工作量会不断增加，直至填满规定的完成时间。当你投身于未知领域时，你的生存就会受到威胁，而且你获得成功的时间也会更少。

data.en: Reason #3 The Theme Of Going Full Circle. Imagine a straight line with black on one end and white on another blended with a gradient. Now, connect the two ends so it forms a circle. There is an instant flip from black to white.
data.zh: 原因三循环往复的主题。想象一条直线，一端是黑色，另一端是白色，并带有渐变效果。现在，将两端连接起来，形成一个圆圈。黑色瞬间变成白色。

data.en: Stop trying to learn "skills." Nothing valuable is built with ONE skill. Instead, learn individual techniques that allow you to build a project that others find useful. Stack techniques, not skills, and you'll slowly reduce your chances of being replaced.
data.zh: 别再试图学习“技能”了。任何有价值的东西都不是靠一项技能就能创造出来的。相反，你应该学习一些能够让你构建出对其他人有用的项目的个人技巧。积累技术，而不是技能，你就能逐渐降低被取代的风险。

data.en: The mind is always listening. If you're always focused on failure, you will fail. If you're always focused on success, you will succeed. Your mind absorbs information that conditions you to acheive your goals, but most people's goal is to fail, they just aren't conscious of it.
data.zh: 人的大脑时刻都在倾听。如果你总是想着失败，你就会失败；如果你总是想着成功，你就会成功。你的大脑会吸收信息，从而形成条件反射，帮助你实现目标，但大多数人的目标却是失败，他们只是没有意识到这一点。

data.en: If you haven't started the project, most of your learning is a wasteful mental masturbation.
data.zh: 如果你还没有开始做项目，那么你的大部分学习都只是浪费时间的脑力自慰。

data.en: Your mind is wired for survival. *It remembers things that helps solve a problem, resolve a pain, or connect a pattern.* When you build a project and get stuck, THAT'S when your mind wants to remember anything that can help.
data.zh: 你的大脑天生具有生存本能。它能记住有助于解决问题、缓解疼痛或建立联系的信息。当你构建一个项目却遇到困难时，你的大脑就会想要回忆起任何可能有所帮助的东西。

data.en: The problem isn't that you don't know what to work on. It's that you haven't tried anything outside of what your parents, teachers, and boss have assigned to you. You haven't experimented with life to the point of finding that one thing you can't help but work on.
data.zh: 问题不在于你不知道该做什么，而在于你除了父母、老师和老板分配给你的任务之外，从未尝试过其他任何事情。你没有真正体验过生活，以至于找不到那件让你情不自禁想要去做的事情。

data.en: If you aren't building toward something, most of your actions are meaningless and repetitive. Your relationships stay surface-level. Your work becomes robotic. Your health starts to slip. You need direction. Because without it, the only option is to get distracted.
data.zh: 如果你没有朝着某个目标努力，那么你的大部分行为都是毫无意义且重复的。你们的关系始终停留在表面。你的工作变得机械化了。你的健康状况开始恶化。你需要方向。因为没有方向，你只会分心。

data.en: It's safe to say that if you want to do your own thing, you will have to write. Emails Messages Posts Articles Video scripts Curriculums Landing pages, ads, captions Most people never learn or practice writing and wonder why they aren’t seeing the traction they want.
data.zh: 可以肯定地说，如果你想做自己想做的事，你就必须写作。电子邮件消息帖子文章视频脚本课程着陆页、广告、标题大多数人从未学习或练习写作，却不明白为什么自己没有获得想要的关注度。

data.en: Social media is the fast food of socialization. Porn is the fast food of intimacy. Video games are the fast food of achievement. Netflix is the fast food of entertainment. Meticulously tested combinations of digital fat, sugar, and salt that trigger your survival instincts.
data.zh: 社交媒体是社交领域的快餐。色情片是亲密关系的快餐。电子游戏是获得成就的快餐。Netflix 就像娱乐界的快餐。经过精心测试的数字脂肪、糖和盐的组合，可以激发你的生存本能。

data.en: My biggest fear is waking up to live the same life as everyone else over and over again. Doing work I don't care about for people I don't care about. Never understanding, always reacting. No energy or time to think, plan, build, or change. Stuck on the surface as decades pass by.
data.zh: 我最大的恐惧是醒来后发现自己过着和其他人一样的生活，日复一日。做着自己不在乎的工作，为自己不在乎的人工作。永远无法理解，永远只是被动应对。没有精力也没有时间去思考、计划、建设或改变。就这样停滞不前，几十年光阴荏苒。

data.en: Do everything in your power to maintain focus on the intersection of what's needed, what matters, and what you feel most drawn to learn and build. If it's not needed, doesn't matter, or you don't care about it, you are wasting your life.
data.zh: 尽你所能，专注于那些真正需要的、重要的，以及你最想学习和创造的东西的交集。如果某件事既不需要，也不重要，或者你根本不在乎，那你就是在浪费生命。

data.en: It’s pretty mind blowing. What started as a few “esoteric health” accounts on Twitter is turning into a US health reform. There no way in hell RFK got the info from mainstream sources. Passionate individuals have a lot of power if they share their ideas and discoveries.
data.zh: 真是令人难以置信。最初只是推特上几个“神秘健康”账号，如今却演变成一场美国医疗改革。罗伯特·肯尼迪绝不可能从主流媒体获得这些信息。充满热情的人如果分享自己的想法和发现，就能拥有很大的力量。

data.en: Most people haven't practiced thinking. When you talk to them, you aren't talking to them. You're talking to the TV. Social media. Their parents. Their teachers. Their insecurities and trauma. It's very robotic. The definition of inauthentic. Disconnect and think more.
data.zh: 大多数人都没有练习过思考。当你和他们说话时，你其实不是在和他们说话，你是在和电视、社交媒体、他们的父母、他们的老师、他们的不安全感和创伤说话。非常机械化，简直就是虚假的代名词。断开网络连接，多思考。

data.en: Most people are trapped in doing mode. Niching their attention down to menial tasks and pleasures without a second thought of what they lead to. They rarely allow themselves to be. So their actions are misaligned by default. They create a life they despise without knowing how.
data.zh: 大多数人都陷入了忙碌模式。他们将注意力集中在琐碎的任务和享乐上，却从不去思考这些行为会导致什么后果。他们很少允许自己真正地做自己。因此，他们的行为自然而然地就偏离了正轨。他们不知不觉地创造出了自己厌恶的生活。

data.en: If you want to make $1 million in 1 year, break it down. $1,000,000 / 12 = $83,333 per month $83,333 / 30 = $2,777 per day Land one $5000 client every other day. Or sell 18 $150 products a day. Thats 720 people to a page that converts at 2.5%. Build a product, distribute.
data.zh: 如果你想在一年内赚到100万美元，那就把目标分解开来。1,000,000 美元 / 12 = 每月 83,333 美元83,333 美元 / 30 = 每天 2,777 美元每隔一天拿下一个价值 5000 美元的客户。或者每天卖出 18 件单价 150 美元的产品。这意味着有 720 人访问了转化率为 2.5% 的页面。开发产品，然后进行分销。

data.en: Set aside 1 hour a day for the 2 most important people in your life: 1) You 2) The person you want to become You can't fill anyone else's cup if you don't have anything to pour.
data.zh: 每天抽出1小时陪伴生命中最重要的人：1）你2）你想成为的那种人如果你自己都没有东西可以倒，又怎么能给别人倒满杯子呢？

data.en: Do what works, in your own way, without getting in your own way.
data.zh: 做对你有效的事，用你自己的方式，但不要给自己设限。

data.en: What more people need to realize is that you were creative, excited, and free until your mind adopted its own limits and you became a know it all. You know where your future is headed. You know what you're doing today. You leave little room for discovery in the unknown.
data.zh: 更多人需要意识到，你曾经充满创造力、热情和自由，直到你的思维被局限，你变成了一个自以为是的人。你知道你的未来走向何方，你知道你今天在做什么，你几乎没有给探索未知留下任何空间。

data.en: Too much structure makes life mundane. Too much spontaneity makes life chaotic. Most of your quality of life stems from finding your own balance.
data.zh: 过多的条条框框会让生活变得单调乏味。过多的随性会让生活变得混乱。你的生活质量很大程度上取决于你能否找到自己的平衡点。

data.en: If you're lost, the answer is education. If you're educated, the answer is execution. If you're executing, the answer is persistence. If you're persisting, the answer is experimentation.
data.zh: 如果你迷失了方向，答案就在于教育。如果你受过教育，答案就是执行。如果你正在执行，答案是坚持不懈。如果你坚持不懈，答案就是实验。

data.en: How to clear your mind: Walk more. Read more. Write more. Listen more. Lift more. Strategize more. Build more. Scroll less. Indulge less. Criticize less. Ruminate less. Sit less. Procrastinate less. You lack clarity because you fill your mind with junk and let ideas go stale.
data.zh: 如何清空思绪：多走路。多读书。多写作。多倾听。多举重。多制定策略。多创造。少刷手机。少放纵自己。少批评别人。少胡思乱想。少久坐。少拖延。你缺乏清晰的思路，是因为你脑子里塞满了垃圾信息，让想法变得陈旧过时。

data.en: Blaming others does absolutely nothing for your life and puts you in a position with zero power to change your situation.
data.zh: 责怪他人对你的生活没有任何帮助，只会让你完全无力改变现状。

data.en: If you can hold a conversation about it, you can write about it. If you can't hold a conversation about it, you should write about it.
data.zh: 如果你能就某件事展开对话，你就能就某件事写出来。如果你无法就此事进行对话，那就应该把它写下来。

data.en: If you don’t know what to write, write about the ideas you want to gain more traction in the world. Politics, health, business, or a specific passion or hobby. Every sentence you write is a vote for which ideas become a part of society.
data.zh: 如果你不知道该写些什么，那就写写你希望在世界上获得更多关注的想法。可以是政治、健康、商业，也可以是你某个特定的爱好或兴趣。你写的每一个字，都是在为哪些想法能够成为社会的一部分投下一票。

data.en: The only things standing between where you are and where you want to be is belief, skill, and knowledge. Beliefs can be changed, skills can be trained, and knowledge can be acquired, but few people care about having a rich life. They find pleasure in the pain of staying the same.
data.zh: 阻碍你到达理想彼岸的唯一障碍是信念、技能和知识。信念可以改变，技能可以训练，知识可以获取，但很少有人真正渴望拥有充实的人生。他们乐于忍受停滞不前的痛苦。

data.en: Most people are so afraid of making mistakes that they make the biggest mistake of them all: not making mistakes.
data.zh: 大多数人害怕犯错，结果犯了最大的错误：不去犯错。

data.en: Ego is the storyteller. The interpreter. The thing that allows you to make sense of the world. You don't dissolve or kill the ego. You grow beyond the limits that keep it narrow and destructive. You expand yourself to the point of higher perspective and holistic storytelling.
data.zh: 自我就是故事讲述者，是诠释者，是让你理解世界的东西。你无法消除或扼杀自我，只能超越那些限制其狭隘和破坏性的局限，从而拓展视野，达到更高的视角和更全面的叙事境界。

data.en: No amount of thinking is going to fix the problem that is solved by doing.
data.zh: 光靠思考是解决不了问题的，行动才能解决问题。

data.en: The best creatives do everything in their power to minimize the time between inspiration and creation.
data.zh: 最优秀的创意人员会竭尽全力缩短灵感迸发到创作完成之间的时间。

data.en: Stop asking yourself what skill you should learn. Start learning the specific techniques necessary to build a project. Then, launch the project, note feedback, learn, fix mistakes, and do it again. The more quality projects you build, the more irreplaceable your skill stack.
data.zh: 不要再问自己应该学习什么技能了。开始学习构建项目所需的具体技术。然后，启动项目，记录反馈，学习，改正错误，再重复一遍。你打造的高质量项目越多，你的技能积累就越不可替代。

data.en: "What skill should I learn" = researching the same thing as everyone else wondering the same thing. "What project am I building" = a learning path that is completely unique to you, because you're creating it on the go.
data.zh: “我应该学习什么技能”= 研究和其他人一样的问题。“我正在构建什么项目”= 一条完全属于你自己的独特学习路径，因为你是在不断创建它。

data.en: One meaningful project. One hour of focused work. One day at a time, without fail. If you're trying to make your part-time your full-time, this is the secret you're looking for.
data.zh: 一个有意义的项目。一小时专注工作。一天一天地过，从未间断。如果你想把兼职变成全职，这就是你一直在寻找的秘诀。

data.en: If you want a better understanding of your mind & reality, here are your study plans for the next year: - Spiral dynamics - Systems thinking - Structure VS content - Cybernetics - Self-bias and deception - Developmental psychology Your ability to think will climb a few levels.
data.zh: 如果你想更好地了解自己的思维和现实，以下是你未来一年的学习计划：螺旋动力学系统思维结构与内容控制论自我偏见和欺骗发展心理学你的思维能力将提升几个层次。

data.en: When you know what you don't want, it doesn't matter if you are crystal clear on what you want. You'll figure it out.
data.zh: 当你清楚自己不想要什么的时候，即使你对自己想要什么也并不那么清楚了。你最终会找到答案的。

data.en: I've reached the stage where I only want to be around people who take their craft seriously. People who've realized that constant complaining is destructive and useless. People who are focused on making the most of their next 24 hours. People who are clear on what they want.
data.zh: 我已经到了只想和那些认真对待自己工作的人在一起的阶段了。那些意识到持续抱怨毫无益处且具有破坏性的人；那些专注于充分利用接下来24小时的人；那些清楚自己想要什么的人。

data.en: Your 20s are the tutorial phase. You're fresh out of society's programming. You have the chance to start over, experiment, and explore. The worst thing you can do is stop learning, obey and end up 60 years old with the beliefs of your 20-year-old self.
data.zh: 你的二十几岁是学习阶段。你刚刚摆脱社会的束缚，有机会重新开始，尝试和探索。最糟糕的情况莫过于停止学习，墨守成规，最终六十岁时还保留着二十岁时的那些想法。

data.en: Your state of mind influences how you see the world. How you see the world influences what opportunities you act on. What you act on influences your quality of life. If you're always stressed and anxious, that will slowly drag you down until you decide to change it.
data.zh: 你的精神状态会影响你对世界的看法。你如何看待世界会影响你抓住哪些机会。你的行为会影响你的生活质量。如果你总是感到压力和焦虑，这会慢慢地把你拖垮，直到你决定改变为止。

data.en: When you're stressed, you regress into a version of your past self. Your mind closes up. It's incredibly difficult to zoom out and see that there are a few potential paths you can start to go down. If you're smart, you have faith in the path, and you step forward anyway.
data.zh: 压力过大时，你会退化成过去的自己。你的思维封闭了。很难跳出固有思维，看到你可以开始走的几条潜在道路。如果你足够聪明，你就会相信这条路，并且无论如何都要勇往直前。

data.en: A few of the simplest things you can do when you want to change your state: - Go on a walk - Journal all thoughts - Breath deep for 10 minutes - Read philosophy - Practice metacognition - Write your way out If you can crack open your mind a bit, you can start to squeeze out.
data.zh: 当你想改变你所在州的状况时，可以做以下几件最简单的事情：去散步记录所有想法深呼吸 10 分钟阅读哲学- 练习元认知用文字走出困境如果你能稍微敞开心扉，你就能开始挤出一些东西。

data.en: Work that is destructive to human health is bound to be replaced. Anything that forces you to stare at screens, sit under fluorescent lights, doesn't allow time for rest, encourages convenient food, etc. Tech and AI are can finally solve this problem, and it will happen fast.
data.zh: 有害于人类健康的工作注定会被取代。任何强迫你盯着屏幕、坐在荧光灯下、不给你休息时间、鼓励你吃方便食品等等的事情。科技和人工智能最终可以解决这个问题，而且很快就会实现。

data.en: Most things can be done quite well on a walk now: - Writing - Research - Meetings - Emails - Marketing - Admin work And as AI continues to develop more work becomes more feasible to do on a walk.
data.zh: 现在大多数事情都可以在散步时很好地完成：写作- 研究会议- 电子邮件- 营销- 行政工作随着人工智能的不断发展，越来越多的工作可以在散步时完成。

data.en: Surround yourself with people who make you want to be better. Not because they tell you to, but because their actions make you realize what's possible.
data.zh: 多和那些能激励你变得更好的人在一起。不是因为他们要求你这样做，而是因为他们的行动让你意识到什么是可能的。

data.en: Don't doubt the person who hates their current situation so much that it becomes an infinite source of motivation and focus.
data.zh: 不要怀疑那些极度厌恶现状，并将之转化为无限动力和专注力的人。

data.en: Again, it's free for personal use. Join the waitlist here and you'll receive access quite soon (possibly within 24 hours). We've rolled out over 23,000 invites so far.
data.zh: 再次强调，它是免费供个人使用的。在此加入候补名单，您很快就能获得访问权限（可能在 24 小时内）。我们目前已发出超过 23,000 份邀请。

data.en: AI making work optional will be a massive blessing and curse. Nobody wants to be on vacation forever. Early retirement is the opposite of the challenge your psyche craves for meaning. People who use it as an opportunity to fuel their passions will thrive.
data.zh: 人工智能让工作变得可有可无，这既是巨大的福音，也是巨大的诅咒。没有人想永远处于度假状态。提前退休与人们内心渴望的挑战和意义背道而驰。那些将其视为激发自身兴趣爱好的机会的人将会取得成功。

data.en: Most people wait to get lucky. Experimentation determines how lucky you can get. The worst thing you can do is stick with a tactic that isn't working (when there absolutely is something you can do that will get results). A lack of experimentation is a lack of intelligence.
data.zh: 大多数人都在等待好运降临。尝试决定你的运气如何。最糟糕的做法就是坚持使用无效的策略（而明明有其他方法可以取得成效）。缺乏实验精神就是缺乏智慧。

data.en: I'm bullish on the creator economy because (1) ideas are infinite (2) ideas shape the future (3) education becomes affordable and tailored to personality (4) encourages growth, uniqueness, and value. Being a creator isn't a job. It's a vessel to be yourself full-time.
data.zh: 我看好创作者经济，因为（1）创意是无限的（2）创意塑造未来（3）教育变得经济实惠，并能根据个性量身定制（4）鼓励成长、独特性和价值。创作不是一份工作，而是一种让你全心全意做自己的方式。

data.en: If you were to stick with this for 1 year, you would have: - 1095 posts on each platform - 104 threads / short YT videos - 52 newsletters / YT videos If you fail with that amount of volume, I don't know what to tell you.
data.zh: 如果你坚持这样做一年，你将拥有：每个平台上共有 1095 篇帖子- 104 个帖子/短 YouTube 视频- 52 份电子报/YouTube 视频如果你连这么大的数量都做不好，那我也不知道该说什么好了。
